text: François Georges René Bruhat (; 8 April 1929 – 17 July 2007) was a French mathematician who worked on algebraic groups. The Bruhat order of a Weyl group, the Bruhat decomposition, and the Schwartz-Bruhat functions are named after him. He was the son of physicist (and associate director of the École Normale Supérieure during the occupation) Georges Bruhat, and brother of physicist Yvonne Choquet-Bruhat. ==References== * * Category:1929 births Category:2007 deaths Category:École Normale Supérieure alumni Category:Members of the French Academy of Sciences Category:Nicolas Bourbaki Category:20th- century French mathematicians Category:21st-century French mathematicians
